qas.question: What publication originally reported a potential deal between Comcast and Time Warner?
What was the value of the deal reported to be at the time?
When did Comcast hope to complete its deal for Time Warner?
How much was Time Warner going to pay Comcast?
Who reported Time Warner had agreed to the deal?

plausible_answers.text: New York City, Los Angeles, Dallas-Fort Worth, Cleveland, Columbus, Cincinnati, Charlotte, San Diego, and San Antonio

qas.question: What metropolitan areas did Comcast give Time Warner?
What was Time Warner Cable attempting to buy?
When do Time Warner and Comcast plan to begin the merger?

context: On February 12, 2014, <a0_0><b4_0>the Los Angeles Times<b4_0/><a0_0/> reported that <b6_0>Comcast<b6_0/> sought to acquire Time Warner Cable in a deal valued at <a1_0><b3_0>$45.2 billion<b3_0/><a1_0/>. On February 13, it was reported that Time Warner Cable agreed to the acquisition. This was to add several metropolitan areas to the Comcast portfolio, such as <b5_0>New York City, Los Angeles, Dallas-Fort Worth, Cleveland, Columbus, Cincinnati, Charlotte, San Diego, and San Antonio<b5_0/>. Time Warner Cable and Comcast aimed to merge into one company <a2_0><b7_0>by the end of 2014<b7_0/><a2_0/> and both have praised the deal, emphasizing the increased capabilities of a combined telecommunications network, and to "create operating efficiencies and economies of scale".
